panic: Panic is not danger. It is a system misfiring under load.
Urgency is a signal error, not a command.
The nervous system is over-reporting threat.
This surge is mechanical, not meaningful.
Alarm intensity does not equal importance.
The system is loud, not broken.
This state is structural, not personal.
The signal is real; the interpretation is not.

GROUNDING: Press both feet into the floor until resistance pushes back.
Place one hand on a solid surface and register texture.
Shift weight slowly from heel to toe.
Notice temperature where skin meets fabric.
Stabilize stance as if bracing lightly.
BREATH: Extend the exhale longer than the inhale.
Breathe out as if releasing excess pressure.
Allow the inhale to arrive on its own.
Let breathing slow without forcing depth.
LOOPS: Interrupt the loop with the phrase 'Not actionable.'
Let the thought pass without correction.
Name the loop and return to sensation.
CONTROL: Choose one action that can be completed in two minutes.
Reduce the next ten minutes to one controllable task.
Decide what will not be done next.
Restore agency by choosing a pause.
Commit to one bounded action only.

closures: End by loosening the jaw and letting the system stand down.
Pause for two seconds before moving again.
Notice what remains stable and unchanged.
Allow the system to idle briefly.
Resume movement only when pressure drops.
